definition: to shout/to bawl/to yell (to urge on an animal)/to hawk (one's wares)/to denounce loudly/to shout slogans
to shout/to bawl/to yell (to urge on an animal)/to hawk (one's wares)

sentences.english: The horse perked up its head when i shouted .
sentences.chinese: 我吆喝时那马扬起了头。

sentences.english: The system mode of the coaches role to athletes during the process of trainning;
sentences.chinese: 教练站在场外向他的运动员吆喝。

sentences.english: The vultures try to move in and are prevented by waving sticks and shouts.
sentences.chinese: 秃鹫们再一次试图靠近但被挥舞的棍棒和吆喝声驱赶。

sentences.english: A shouted order flouts over the water.
sentences.chinese: 命令的吆喝声从水面上飘出去。

sentences.english: I ought to yell, " said my father dolefully ."
sentences.chinese: “我应该吆喝才是，”父亲悲戚地说。

sentences.english: The captain bawled out the orders.
Both of us wore baseball caps,and she still wanted to cry out for customers along the street in market.i stoped it immediately.i
sentences.chinese: 我俩都带着棒球帽，她还想吆喝几声，被我及时制止。

sentences.english: And I got in the car and she was screaming.
sentences.chinese: 我上了车，她便大声吆喝。

sentences.english: The man affirmed in assertion that he aimed to accost the accidental affirmation.
sentences.chinese: 那个人吆喝着申明说他盘算索回无目的的索赔。

sentences.english: After independence we would no longer be at the beck and call of the colonial master.
sentences.chinese: 独立之后我们将不再听候殖民宗主国的吆喝和指使。

sentences.english: The beach rang with young people's shouts.
sentences.chinese: 海滩上响起了年轻人的吆喝声。

definition: to argue noisily/to shout/to make widely known/to reproach
to cry out/to bark out a sound
to raise one's voice/to speak at the top of one's voice
to yell/to shout/to call out for (a person)
to shout and quarrel/to make a big fuss
to murmur/to speak in a low voice
